pullRequest.title: Fixes #4904 - WebsocketClient creates more connections than needed.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixed connection pool's acquire() methods to correctly take into account the number of queued requests.
Also fixed a collateral bug in BufferingResponseListener - wrong calculation of the max content length.
Restored ConnectionPoolTest that was disabled in #2540, cleaned it up, and let it run for hours without failures.
Signed-off-by: Simone Bordet simone.bordet@gmail.com

commit.message:
Fixes #4904 - WebsocketClient creates more connections than needed.

Fixed connection pool's `acquire()` methods to correctly take into account the number of queued requests.

Also fixed a collateral bug in `BufferingResponseListener` - wrong calculation of the max content length.

Restored `ConnectionPoolTest` that was disabled in #2540, cleaned it up, and let it run for hours without failures.

Signed-off-by: Simone Bordet <simone.bordet@gmail.com>

Fixes #4904 - WebsocketClient creates more connections than needed.

More fixes to the connection pool logic.
Now the connection creation is conditional, triggered by
explicit send() or failures.
The connection creation is not triggered _after_ a send(),
where we aggressively send more queued requests - or
in release(), where we send queued request after a previous
one was completed.

Signed-off-by: Simone Bordet <simone.bordet@gmail.com>

Fixes #4904 - WebsocketClient creates more connections than needed.

More fixes to the connection pool logic.
Now the connection close/removal aggressively sends more
requests triggering the connection creation.

Signed-off-by: Simone Bordet <simone.bordet@gmail.com>

Fixes #4904 - WebsocketClient creates more connections than needed.

Improved comments.

Signed-off-by: Simone Bordet <simone.bordet@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: IF this can now only be a HttpDestination, why not change the signature of the constructor?
javadoc needed to explain the behaviour of this method...  well perhaps tryCreate needs more javadoc too...
should this check that the queue is not 0?  Why acquire a connection if there are no waiting exchanges?

commit.message:
Fixes #4904 - WebsocketClient creates more connections than needed.

Updates after review: added javadocs.

nodes.bodyText: Does it always create a new connection?    This should say if possible or may schedule.... . At the very least refer to tryCreate for the actual strategy applied.

Opps didn't see that.
An else if (removed) would be clearer that there is a condition above.

nodes.bodyText:
How about this one-liner instead?
int maxPending = (destination.getQueuedRequestCount() + getMaxMultiplex() - 1) / getMaxMultiplex();
The documented contract is not respected by the RoundRobinConnectionPool subclass. That should probably be documented too.
Since close(Connection) and remove(Connection) are now identical, shouldn't one of them be removed?
As mentioned earlier, this implementation breaks the javadoc's contract.
